intro: Clidemia hematostemon, commonly known as the red-stemmed mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Melastomataceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and showy, pink to red flowers. The plant has a woody stem that is often covered in a reddish hue, which gives it its common name. It attaches to host trees through specialized structures called haustoria, drawing water and nutrients from the host. Clidemia hematostemon is often found in shaded, humid environments and plays a role in local ecosystems as both a parasite and a food source for certain insects and birds.
